repos.name: ttf-web
repos.description: The Talent Foundation replit built - Full-stack talent enablement platform
repos.purpose: B2B talent enablement platform for senior executives showcasing services through the IIEA framework (Illuminate, Innovate, Elevate, Accelerate)
features: Professional B2B talent enablement services showcase
IIEA framework presentation (Illuminate, Innovate, Elevate, Accelerate)
Advanced SEO optimization with structured data (JSON-LD)
AI search agent optimization (ChatGPT, Anthropic, Perplexity)
Responsive design with TF brand colors (orange #e84e36, blue #02a7e1)

architecture.build_system: Vite for frontend, esbuild for backend

recent_activity.description: Updated Git repository configuration and hooks
Logo sizing adjustments to prevent stretching

relationships.ttf-web-nextjs: Migration target - ttf-web-nextjs is a Next.js rewrite of this application

repos.development_focus: Active development on Replit with focus on SEO, PWA features, and premium UX

repos.name: ttf-web-nextjs
repos.description: Next.js migration of The Talent Foundation website
repos.purpose: Next.js 15 migration of ttf-web with improved SSR/SSG, Supabase integration, and production-ready architecture
features: Complete Next.js 15 migration with App Router
All 19 pages successfully migrated and building
Full SSR/SSG support for better SEO
JWT-based authentication with bcrypt password hashing
Professional Navigation component with TTF logo and branding
Services dropdown menu with icons and descriptions
Complete TTF brand color system (orange #e84e36, blue #02a7e1)
All service pages: Illuminate, Innovate, Elevate, Accelerate
Who We Serve page with strategic positioning
Complete content migration from final copy assets
Card hover effects and visual enhancements
ROI analysis and ecosystem integration content

architecture.development: Next.js dev server with hot reload

pages_migrated: Homepage (/) - Complete final copy with hero, problem/pain, ecosystem, differentiation
About (/about) - Founder profile, principles, boutique model
Services (/services) - Detailed ecosystem explanation and ROI analysis
Contact (/contact) - Strategic call booking and inquiry form
Illuminate (/illuminate) - Market intelligence and strategic foresight
Innovate (/innovate) - System design and process optimization
Who We Serve (/who-we-serve) - Strategic positioning and expertise

recent_activity.description: Complete UI/UX migration matching original TTF design with navigation, footer, and brand system
Final service pages (Elevate, Accelerate, Who We Serve) and 404 page
Illuminate and Innovate service pages with full content
Homepage, About, Services, Contact pages with final copy

migration_status.design_fidelity: Carbon copy of original client design

relationships.ttf-web: Migration source - This is the Next.js rewrite of ttf-web
improvements_over_ttf_web: Next.js 15 SSR/SSG for better SEO and performance
Supabase production database instead of Neon
JWT authentication with bcrypt for better security
All 19 pages with final copy content

repos.development_focus: Production-ready Next.js migration with complete content and professional design system

repos.name: CMW-Demo
repos.purpose: Demo platform for ConnectMyVariant.org featuring variant-specific private message boards and secure access control
features: Admin interface for user and variant group management
Secure access control based on variant assignments
Custom Variant Forum module for message board functionality
Demo credentials for testing (admin and variant users)

architecture.access_control: Group module with custom variant logic
architecture.forums: Custom Variant Forum module + Drupal Forum

recent_activity.description: Apache DocumentRoot and configuration adjustments for DigitalOcean
Added composer.lock and .htaccess updates for deployment
Fixed CSS/JS loading issues on DigitalOcean deployment

security_features: User authentication required for all message board access
Variant-specific access control (users can only access assigned variant boards)
No sensitive medical data storage (privacy-first design)

relationships.ttf_web: Separate client project - No direct technical relationship
relationships.ttf_web_nextjs: Separate client project - No direct technical relationship
relationships.client: ConnectMyVariant.org - Different from The Talent Foundation services

repos.development_focus: Stable demo platform for ConnectMyVariant with variant-specific community features

organizational_insights.primary_business: The Talent Foundation - B2B talent enablement for senior executives

brand_identity.positioning: Boutique talent enablement agency for senior executives
differentiators: Custom system design and process optimization

technology_strategy.migration_status: Completed - 19/19 pages migrated with full content

activity_timeline.2025-09-13: ttf-web active development (Git config, UI polish)

common_patterns.ui_library: shadcn/ui + Radix UI across all modern projects
common_patterns.validation: Zod schemas for type-safe data validation
common_patterns.forms: React Hook Form for form state management

next_steps: Deploy ttf-web-nextjs to Vercel (migration is complete and production-ready)
Sunset ttf-web Replit instance once Next.js version is live
Implement A/B testing between old and new platforms
Set up monitoring and analytics on Next.js deployment
Consider migrating CMW-Demo to modern stack if client relationship continues
technical_debt: ttf-web uses older Vite-based architecture (superseded by Next.js migration)
CMW-Demo uses Drupal 10 (consider headless CMS alternative)
optimization_opportunities: Consolidate to single database provider (Supabase recommended)
Implement shared component library across projects
Set up monorepo with shared utilities
